clumpy.definition.LandUseCoverLayer¶

class clumpy.definition.LandUseCoverLayer(name=None, time=0, path=None, data=None, path_copy_metadata=None)[source]¶

Bases: clumpy.definition._layer._Layer

Defines a Land Use Cover (LUC) layer. This layer can then used for the calibration stage or the allocation stage:

luc1998 = clumpy.definition.layer.LayerLUC(name='LUC-1998',scale=15,time=0)
Parameters

  • name (TYPE, optional) – DESCRIPTION. The default is None.

  • time (TYPE, optional) – DESCRIPTION. The default is 0.

  • path (TYPE, optional) – DESCRIPTION. The default is None.

  • data (TYPE, optional) – DESCRIPTION. The default is None.

  • path_copy_metadata (TYPE, optional) – DESCRIPTION. The default is None.

Returns

Return type

None.

Methods

display(self, center, window)

Display the land use cover layer through python console with matplotlib.

export_asc(self, path[, verbose])

Export the layer data as an asc file in order to use it through CLUES and CLUMondo.

set_style(self, style)

set display style
display(self, center, window)[source]¶

Display the land use cover layer through python console with matplotlib.

Parameters

  • values (list of int) – List of displayed states.

  • colors (list of str) – List of colors in HTML format.

  • names (list of names) – List of state names.

  • center (tuple of two integers) – Center position as a tuple.

  • window (tuple of two integers) – Window dimensions as a tuple.

export_asc(self, path, verbose=0)¶

Export the layer data as an asc file in order to use it through CLUES and CLUMondo.

Parameters

  • path (str) – path to the file.

  • verbose (int, default=0) – level of verbosity.

set_style(self, style)[source]¶

set display style

Parameters

style (json) – The style. See example and user guide.
